verses.verse: To the chief Musician <S%H5329><s%> upon <S%H413><s%> Shoshannim-eduth, <S%H7802><s%> A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> of Asaph. <S%H623><s%> Give ear, <S%H238><s%> O Shepherd <S%H7462><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> thou that leadest <S%H5090><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%> like a flock; <S%H6629><s%> thou that dwellest <S%H3427><s%> between the cherubims, <S%H3742><s%> shine forth. <S%H3313><s%>

Before <S%H6440><s%> Ephraim <S%H669><s%> and Benjamin <S%H1144><s%> and Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> stir up <S%H5782><s%> <S%H853><s%> thy strength, <S%H1369><s%> and come <S%H1980><s%> and save <S%H3444><s%> us.
Turn us again, <S%H7725><s%> O God, <S%H430><s%> and cause thy face <S%H6440><s%> to shine; <S%H215><s%> and we shall be saved. <S%H3467><s%>
O LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of hosts, <S%H6635><s%> how long <S%H5704><s%> <S%H4970><s%> wilt thou be angry <S%H6225><s%> against the prayer <S%H8605><s%> of thy people? <S%H5971><s%>
Thou feedest <S%H398><s%> them with the bread <S%H3899><s%> of tears; <S%H1832><s%> and givest them tears <S%H1832><s%> to drink <S%H8248><s%> in great measure. <S%H7991><s%>
Thou makest <S%H7760><s%> us a strife <S%H4066><s%> unto our neighbors: <S%H7934><s%> and our enemies <S%H341><s%> laugh <S%H3932><s%> among themselves.
Turn us again, <S%H7725><s%> O God <S%H430><s%> of hosts, <S%H6635><s%> and cause thy face <S%H6440><s%> to shine; <S%H215><s%> and we shall be saved. <S%H3467><s%>
Thou hast brought <S%H5265><s%> a vine <S%H1612><s%> out of Egypt: <S%H4480><s%> <S%H4714><s%> thou hast cast out <S%H1644><s%> the heathen, <S%H1471><s%> and planted <S%H5193><s%> it.
Thou preparedst <S%H6437><s%> room before <S%H6440><s%> it, and didst cause it to take deep root, <S%H8327><s%> <S%H8328><s%> and it filled <S%H4390><s%> the land. <S%H776><s%>
The hills <S%H2022><s%> were covered <S%H3680><s%> with the shadow <S%H6738><s%> of it, and the boughs <S%H6057><s%> thereof were like the goodly <S%H410><s%> cedars. <S%H730><s%>
She sent out <S%H7971><s%> her boughs <S%H7105><s%> unto <S%H5704><s%> the sea, <S%H3220><s%> and her branches <S%H3127><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> the river. <S%H5104><s%>
Why <S%H4100><s%> hast thou then broken down <S%H6555><s%> her hedges, <S%H1447><s%> so that all <S%H3605><s%> they which pass by <S%H5674><s%> the way <S%H1870><s%> do pluck <S%H717><s%> her?
The boar <S%H2386><s%> out of the wood <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3293><s%> doth waste <S%H3765><s%> it, and the wild beast <S%H2123><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%> doth devour <S%H7462><s%> it.

Return, <S%H7725><s%> we beseech <S%H4994><s%> thee, O God <S%H430><s%> of hosts: <S%H6635><s%> look down <S%H5027><s%> from heaven, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H8064><s%> and behold, <S%H7200><s%> and visit <S%H6485><s%> this <S%H2063><s%> vine; <S%H1612><s%>
And the vineyard <S%H3657><s%> which <S%H834><s%> thy right hand <S%H3225><s%> hath planted, <S%H5193><s%> and the branch <S%H1121><s%> that thou madest strong <S%H553><s%> for thyself.
It is burned <S%H8313><s%> with fire, <S%H784><s%> it is cut down: <S%H3683><s%> they perish <S%H6><s%> at the rebuke <S%H4480><s%> <S%H1606><s%> of thy countenance. <S%H6440><s%>

Let thy hand <S%H3027><s%> be <S%H1961><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> the man <S%H376><s%> of thy right hand, <S%H3225><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> whom thou madest strong <S%H553><s%> for thyself.
So will not <S%H3808><s%> we go back <S%H5472><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> thee: quicken <S%H2421><s%> us, and we will call <S%H7121><s%> upon thy name. <S%H8034><s%>
Turn us again, <S%H7725><s%> O LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of hosts, <S%H6635><s%> cause thy face <S%H6440><s%> to shine; <S%H215><s%> and we shall be saved. <S%H3467><s%>
